PRESS RELEASE -

The Board of Education had an emergency meeting tonight to address several comments and concerns that have come from administrators, teachers, and staff.

The first change was to the school calendar. The change included a delay of the school start date to Monday, August 31st and will add an in-service day to Friday, September 4. This will allow our quarantined staff to be back full time, and will allow for additional time for training and getting the classrooms ready.

The Board also voted to designate the Copper River School District as a critical infrastructure. This allows for additional guidelines and protocols to safely ensure our students can get back into the classrooms.

As a reminder, situations as they relate to COVID-19 are ever-changing. Please make sure you ask questions and communicate through your school administrators.

School zoom meetings will continue to occur on Tuesdays at noon. Please visit the CRSD website for meeting details.

Therese Ashton
Superintendent

Jaime Matthews
CRSD Board President

post_text: Waterford UPSTART is a new program in Alaska for four-year old children. This program is designed to prepare four-year old children for kindergarten. Each child receives a fun and individualized curriculum for either early reading, math and science (with an emphasis on early literacy) that is done 5 days a week, 15-20 minutes per day. In addition to the software, each family is provided with a laptop computer (which they'll get to keep if they meet the usage requirement) as well as Internet access if needed - all at no cost. We also pair each family with a coach to track and monitor the child's usage of the program, answer any technical or motivational questions, and support the family so that they can continue learning offline. The only requirement to participate is that the child be planning to start Kindergarten fall of 2021. Families that are interested can register by visiting www.waterfordupstart.org/register or by calling 1-888-982-9898.

In 2010, the Copper River Watershed Project released a new scholarship program for seniors from the Copper River watershed who are graduating and pursuing continued education that will benefit the culture, environment, or economy of the region.

Two $1000 scholarships will be awarded annually in the spring to one graduating student from a school in the Copper Basin (Glennallen, Kenny Lake or Slana High Schools) and one graduating student from Cordova High School. Homeschool students in the region are also eligible to apply as well as students who have spent a significant portion of their schooling in the Copper River watershed or students who have significant ties to the region.

Download the 2020 Scholarship Application. Applications are due April 10, 2020. Incomplete applications will not be considered, so please make sure all sections are completed.

For more information, contact Kate Morse with any questions at (907) 424-3334 or email kate@copperriver.

https://copperriver.org/programs/watershed-education/scholarship-program/

Acceleration Academy students advance one full level in math or science during each five week summer session.
The ANSEP Acceleration Academy (Summer):

-eliminates remediation;
-reduces the time to Bachelor’s degree for college students;
-saves families college costs;
-saves the State of Alaska millions of dollars in general fund support; and
-increases the economic opportunities for students and their families.

The Acceleration Academy (Summer) is a 5-week opportunity that is held on the University of Alaska Anchorage (UAA) campus and hosted by ANSEP. Students will be housed on the UAA campus for the duration of the ANSEP Acceleration Academy (Summer).

The 2020 5-week session dates will be held from May 24 to June 26, 2020.

Application Deadline: POSTMARKED by March 6, 2020

For questions, contact us at the email or phone number below:

uaa_ansepacceleration@alaska.edu or 907-786-0905.
